ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Emergency room:
Notes: 1= Psychiatric Emergency Program; 2= Emergency Service; 3= Emergency Department

ElementDescription: Current gender identity
Notes: 0 = Male; 1 = Female; 2 = Trans male/Trans man; 3 = Trans female/Trans woman; 4 = Genderqueer or Gender non-conforming; 5 = Different identity; 6 = Non-binary; 7 = Refused/prefer not to answer; 8 = Do not know; 9 = Not listed; 10 = Multiple identities listed; 11 = Gender fluid; 999 = Missing

ElementDescription: Subject's Primary Language
Race of study subject
ValueRange: American Indian/Alaska Native; Asian; Hawaiian or Pacific Islander; Black or African American; White; More than one race; Unknown or not reported; Other Non-White; Other

ElementDescription: Ethnicity of participant
ValueRange: Hispanic or Latino; Not Hispanic or Latino; Unknown

ElementDescription: Age (years: months: days)
Grade in school
Notes: -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: Have you ever been left back a grade?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: In school, do you get any extra help for learning?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: How many caregivers live at home with you (this may include parents, legal guardians, grandparents, or another adult who takes care of you):
Notes: Number of People

ElementDescription: Sine the start of the coronavirus pandemic, how many of these caregivers worked outside of the home?
Notes: Number of People

ElementDescription: Since the start of the coronavirus pandemic, how much time have you spent in remote schooling (going to school online)?
Notes: 0= None, I did not go to school online.; 1= A little; 2= Sometimes; 4= Most of the time; 5= Almost all of the time; 6= All, I only went to online school/I did not go to school in-person

ElementDescription: Since the start of the coronavirus pandemic, how have your grades in school been compared to before the pandemic?
Notes: 1= Much worse; 2= A bit worse; 3= About the same; 4= A bit better; 5= Much better

ElementDescription: Since the start of the coronavirus pandemic, how often have you been able to see your friends compared to before the pandemic?
Notes: 1= Much less often; 2= A bit less often; 3= About the same; 4= A bit more often; 5= Much more often

Notes: 1= None; 2= Mild; 3= Moderate; 4= Severe

Notes: 1= None; 2= Mild; 3= Moderate; 4= Severe

Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

Notes: Number of People

Notes: 1= Mild; 2= Moderate; 3= Severe; 4= Family member died from coronavirus
